item.title: Railway → México City
item.description: This time, Railway visited México City.

item.title: Spacing and Density
item.description: Spacing is used in visual design to create visual relationships and hierarchy. Think of space as the “empty” space you leave between one note and the next one to form rhythm. Have you noticed how the horizontal space between characters (tracking) is smaller than the blank space we put between “groups” of letter we call words, and how that space is smaller than the vertical space between vertical lines? So now we have lines.

item.description: Performance Upgrades It is for these reasons that I regard the decision last year to shift our efforts in space from low to high gear as among the most important decisions that will be made during my incumbency in the office of the Presidency. item.title: testy test
item.description: Senior Product Designer ft Software QA

item.title: About
item.description: Hello! I’m Jitachi I like to study the relationship we have with the artifacts we create for ourselves, how they shape the way we think, and how they expand what we believe is possible. In simple terms, I’m a designer. I’ve been obsessed with technology, magic, and modding my surroundings since I was a kid. Creating artifacts to help others move forward is my love language. I believe that anything a human creates carries traces of its maker: the imprint of time, culture, beliefs, intention, and values.
